text: Yeah juggling has been in most fighting games over the years, but it was a small part. You'd get someone in the air and get 2, maybe 3 or 4 hits on. These days all the main combos are juggles, they're the focus of the combat systems, which they never used to be. And it's terrible.

author: metal fox 913 ITA

text: After T5(T6/TTT2) the juggles went a little overboard thx to bound. Now players use sweep and launch all the time to get you in the air :/ Tekken players use only launch/sweep and fast mid/high/low hits these day. Throws,reversals,10 hit combos and normal attacks is almost gone or useless. But Tekken Revolution actually took away bound, so maybe Tekken 7 will include no bound, that means back to Tekken 5 gameplay style.
author: MrNinjafreak

text: Great track, if you dnt like tekken juggles just learn to avoid them and counter with a combo/juggle of your own.

text: I'm going to buy Tekken Tag 2 (although I really feel they should have released it 5 years ago) and I just know I'm going to hate it. Tag team juggles are bad enough on the otherwise awesome Street Fighter X Tekken and I'm not looking forward to being rendered unable to do anything for half a fight in the new Tekken game, I'm giving the franchise one more chance to try and keep me as a fan. But I'm not holding my breath.

text: (Last sentence typo) "It" instead of "in"
author: ZXeroAdventVideos

text: Some juggles are easy to do, others are not. Tekken is still about the mind game aspect  as I stated before. You (in general) as a player need to start predicting your opponent. there are several different ways you can defend against a launcher. Most hop kicks are actually bad if blocked because it leaves them wide open. If someone hop kicks you, Counter it with a very fast move. I love juggles in tekken personally, so I cant agree with you. Learn and see if there is a way to defend in b4 hating
author: ZXeroAdventVideos

text: You say learn how to defend against it. All it takes it for them to press up and circle and boom, they can start their juggle. So to defend against juggles I have to never get hit. Tekken wasn't like that before Tekken 5. It's not really the juggles themselves that irritate me (although they do) its more how easy it is to do them.
author: Harperlarp

text: Actually thats terribly incorrect. I play tons of Tekken, and its getting more interesting each installment. If you rely on juggles you will lose.... Period. It is still about making your foe "choke" and make a mistake. That's what mix-ups and stuffs for. I still see a ton of "countering" such as the universal low parry. Perhaps you didn't play online enough to actually get a remotely good experience? If people have such a problem with juggling, why not learn how to defend against it?
author: ZXeroAdventVideos

author: FlopHouseKing

text: wholly ridiculous. i've made points. good ones. ones that you've yet to refute, much less answer with anything other than nonsensical insults. in tekken 5 many characters could do massive damage off of one combo, and in older tekken games, 5-6 hits with any character usually ended a round. regardless, if all you're going to do is reply with insults and homoerotic fantasy, then don't bother to respond, as any further back and forth between us would be without value.
author: FlopHouseKing

text: if you want to be and old school "purist" who thinks tekken should go back to 5-6 hits winning a round, or the "golden" era of tekken 5 where 5-6 combos still did roughly the same damage you're complaining about, that's fine, but don't hate on the new just because your strategy of...."ten hit bnb's" is nowhere NEAR as effective as it used to be....friggin ten hit strings....can't believe you, a tekken vet, sort THAT of all in things into your "viable tricks" bag.
author: FlopHouseKing

text: in fact, watch?v=fD8Sq-n6kb0&feature=related, this match has everything. lower and higher tier characters, top level players, juggles, pokes, and the kind of mental strategy this game has evolved into since "ten hit bnb's" now tell me what's wrong with any of what you see other than an american being free to korea. again.
author: FlopHouseKing

text: bread and butter ten hit strings? what? CLEARLY you are stuck at the casual level of the metagame if you even have any idea of what that is in this game. Spam? really? are you one of those players who EXPECTS players not to do what works in order to win, simply because it works? because it sounds like you're exactly the kind of player who sends rage mail for being out poked. there are pokes in this game btw. also i haven't commented on what a great track this is....man what a a great track
author: FlopHouseKing

text: (cont) and another thing, it isnt simply that I just dislike playing against juggle spammers, I dont even like watching Tekken tourneys anymore because of it. The definition of skill in that game has morphed to the point where it damn near doesnt exist. Launch, spam combo,pray for bounce or break finish spamming.Yeah real talent huh?I'll just continue to fuck players like that up with bread and butter old school 10 hits, and my other tricks i've picked up over years of NOT playing like a pussy.
author: thangQanime

text: it honestly sounds like you don't like it, only because you get hit with it enough to warrant annoyance, which means you've played the game but not nearly enough to learn how not to get hit by them. which for the sake of argument is ridiculous
author: FlopHouseKing

text: damn didn't know i was so good at baiting.you should try it lol. i did go ham on the friend line only because you were being fake about it. clearly there aren't many vets who feel the same as you do or the game would be different now wouldn't it? the rage system first appeared in the arguably the most popular game in the franchise so it was bound to stick, as did most other things found in the first tekken tag. juggles and launchers are good, but not supreme as there are plenty of ways around it
author: FlopHouseKing

text: not every match boils down to who can launch who first. honestly if you want to cling to the notion that three hits for half health is better than one juggle for 45%, that's up to you. and to be even more frank, if you're getting hit with 60-70% juggles, you deserve it.i've played the every game in the franchise from tekken 2 and can honestly say that i like where tekken is at right now. as do most people who support it. and friend? fucking really? if you don't knock it off with that bullshit...
author: FlopHouseKing

text: Patterned juggling matches is shit. It basically becomes a Yugioh-esque turn based game to see who manages to launch the other guy first, then its the same fuckin follow up combos every time until one dies. It's pathetic. The first guy was right, and if you dont agree and you call urself a tekken vet, you lack principals, friend.

author: Kountri Boi

text: Yeah it is now, and it shouldn't be. You used to be able to get just a couple of hits on a juggle, now it's half your opponent's health bar. It's no longer about trying to force your opponent into making a mistake and reversing/countering, it's about who gets a shitty launcher on first. Tekken has changed and I'm sad to say for the worse (unless you enjoy spending half of a fight in mid air totally helpless).
